2. Duplicate episode IDs (f20686e): Added startId parameter to createEpisodeList() to avoid duplicate primary keys

comments.author: cclawton
comments.text:
Fixed TooManyRequestsException crash in NetworkStateMonitor:

Root cause: Each Hilt test component created a new NetworkStateMonitor singleton, each registering a ConnectivityManager callback. After ~100 tests, Android's callback limit was exceeded.

Solution:
1. Created PrivacyModule to explicitly provide NetworkStateMonitor (removed @Inject/@Singleton from class)
2. Added skipCallbackRegistration parameter to NetworkStateMonitor for test mode
3. Created TestPrivacyModule that replaces PrivacyModule in tests, providing a NetworkStateMonitor that doesn't register callbacks

The test NetworkStateMonitor reports network as available/unmetered by default, which is the expected state for most UI tests.

PlayerScreenTest has 13 failures (51% pass rate). All failures are ComposeTimeoutException waiting for player controls that require an episode to be playing.
